titlealts.searchtitle: NHS Business Definition: Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Tool - Description

div.p: The Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Tool is a type of ASSESSMENT TOOL.
The Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Tool is used to assess PATIENTS (aged 16 or over) admitted to a Hospital Provider, for the risk of Venous Thromboembolism.

For further guidance on the Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Tool, see the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) website at: Venous thromboembolism in over 16s: reducing the risk of hospital-acquired deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism.
